header.title: crypto

description.p: This module provides a set of cryptographic functions.

item.p: md4: The MD4 Message Digest Algorithm (RFC 1320)
md5: The MD5 Message Digest Algorithm (RFC 1321)
ecb, cbc, cfb, ofb, ctr: Recommendation for Block Cipher Modes of Operation (NIST SP 800-38A).
rsa: Recommendation for Block Cipher Modes of Operation (NIST 800-38A)

description.p: The above publications can be found at NIST publications, at IETF.
description.pre: byte() = 0 ... 255 ioelem() = byte() | binary() | iolist() iolist() = [ioelem()] Mpint() = <<ByteLen:32/integer-big, Bytes:ByteLen/binary>>

func.fsummary: Start the crypto server.

desc.p: Starts the crypto server.

func.fsummary: Provide a list of available crypto functions.

desc.p: Provides the available crypto functions in terms of a list of atoms.

func.name: info_lib() -> [{Name,VerNum,VerStr}]
func.fsummary: Provides information about the libraries used by crypto.

desc.p: Provides the name and version of the libraries used by crypto.
Name is the name of the library. VerNum is the numeric version according to the library's own versioning scheme. VerStr contains a text variant of the version.

note.p: From OTP R16 the numeric version represents the version of the OpenSSL header files (openssl/opensslv.h) used when crypto was compiled. The text variant represents the OpenSSL library used at runtime. In earlier OTP versions both numeric and text was taken from the library.

type.v: Type = md4 | md5 | ripemd160 | sha | sha224 | sha256 | sha384 | sha512

desc.p: Computes a message digest of type Type from Data.
May throw exception notsup in case the chosen Type is not supported by the underlying OpenSSL implementation.

type.v: Type = md4 | md5 | ripemd160 | sha | sha224 | sha256 | sha384 | sha512

desc.p: Initializes the context for streaming hash operations. Type determines which digest to use. The returned context should be used as argument to hash_update.
May throw exception notsup in case the chosen Type is not supported by the underlying OpenSSL implementation.

Updates the digest represented by Context using the given Data. Context must have been generated using hash_init or a previous call to this function. Data can be any length. NewContext must be passed into the next call to hash_update or hash_final.
Finalizes the hash operation referenced by Context returned from a previous call to hash_update. The size of Digest is determined by the type of hash function used to generate it.

func.name: hmac(Type, Key, Data) -> Mac
hmac(Type, Key, Data, MacLength) -> Mac

type.v: Type = md5 | sha | sha224 | sha256 | sha384 | sha512

func.desc: Computes a HMAC of type Type from Data using Key as the authentication key. MacLength will limit the size of the resultant Mac.

type.v: Type = md5 | ripemd160 | sha | sha224 | sha256 | sha384 | sha512

desc.p: Initializes the context for streaming HMAC operations. Type determines which hash function to use in the HMAC operation. Key is the authentication key. The key can be any length.

Updates the HMAC represented by Context using the given Data. Context must have been generated using an HMAC init function (such as hmac_init). Data can be any length. NewContext must be passed into the next call to hmac_update.
Finalizes the HMAC operation referenced by Context. The size of the resultant MAC is determined by the type of hash function used to generate it.

Finalizes the HMAC operation referenced by Context. HashLen must be greater than zero. Mac will be a binary with at most HashLen bytes. Note that if HashLen is greater than the actual number of bytes returned from the underlying hash, the returned hash will have fewer than HashLen bytes.

func.name: des_cbc_encrypt(Key, IVec, Text) -> Cipher
func.fsummary: Encrypt Textaccording to DES in CBC mode

desc.p: Encrypts Text according to DES in CBC mode. Text must be a multiple of 64 bits (8 bytes). Key is the DES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. The lengths of Key and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.name: des_cbc_decrypt(Key, IVec, Cipher) -> Text
func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to DES in CBC mode

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to DES in CBC mode. Key is the DES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. Key and IVec must have the same values as those used when encrypting. Cipher must be a multiple of 64 bits (8 bytes). The lengths of Key and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.name: des_cbc_ivec(Data) -> IVec
func.fsummary: Get IVec to be used in next iteration of des_cbc_[ecrypt|decrypt]

desc.p: Returns the IVec to be used in a next iteration of des_cbc_[encrypt|decrypt]. Data is the encrypted data from the previous iteration step.

func.name: des_cfb_encrypt(Key, IVec, Text) -> Cipher
func.fsummary: Encrypt Textaccording to DES in CFB mode

desc.p: Encrypts Text according to DES in 8-bit CFB mode. Key is the DES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. The lengths of Key and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.name: des_cfb_decrypt(Key, IVec, Cipher) -> Text
func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to DES in CFB mode

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to DES in 8-bit CFB mode. Key is the DES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. Key and IVec must have the same values as those used when encrypting. The lengths of Key and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.name: des_cfb_ivec(IVec, Data) -> NextIVec
func.fsummary: Get IVec to be used in next iteration of des_cfb_[ecrypt|decrypt]

desc.p: Returns the IVec to be used in a next iteration of des_cfb_[encrypt|decrypt]. IVec is the vector used in the previous iteration step. Data is the encrypted data from the previous iteration step.

func.name: des3_cbc_encrypt(Key1, Key2, Key3, IVec, Text) -> Cipher
func.fsummary: Encrypt Textaccording to DES3 in CBC mode

desc.p: Encrypts Text according to DES3 in CBC mode. Text must be a multiple of 64 bits (8 bytes). Key1, Key2, Key3, are the DES keys, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. The lengths of each of Key1, Key2, Key3 and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.name: des3_cbc_decrypt(Key1, Key2, Key3, IVec, Cipher) -> Text
func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to DES3 in CBC mode

type.v: Key1 = Key2 = Key3 = Cipher = iolist() | binary()

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to DES3 in CBC mode. Key1, Key2, Key3 are the DES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. Key1, Key2, Key3 and IVec must and IVec must have the same values as those used when encrypting. Cipher must be a multiple of 64 bits (8 bytes). The lengths of Key1, Key2, Key3, and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.fsummary: Encrypt Textaccording to DES3 in CFB mode

desc.p: Encrypts Text according to DES3 in 8-bit CFB mode. Key1, Key2, Key3, are the DES keys, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. The lengths of each of Key1, Key2, Key3 and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).
May throw exception notsup for old OpenSSL versions (0.9.7) that does not support this encryption mode.

func.name: des3_cfb_decrypt(Key1, Key2, Key3, IVec, Cipher) -> Text
func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to DES3 in CFB mode

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to DES3 in 8-bit CFB mode. Key1, Key2, Key3 are the DES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. Key1, Key2, Key3 and IVec must and IVec must have the same values as those used when encrypting. The lengths of Key1, Key2, Key3, and IVec must be 64 bits (8 bytes).

func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to AES in Cipher Feedback mode

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to AES in Cipher Feedback Mode (CFB). Key is the AES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. Key and IVec must have the same values as those used when encrypting. The lengths of Key and IVec must be 128 bits (16 bytes).

func.name: aes_cbc_128_encrypt(Key, IVec, Text) -> Cipher
func.fsummary: Encrypt Textaccording to AES in Cipher Block Chaining mode

desc.p: Encrypts Text according to AES in Cipher Block Chaining mode (CBC). Text must be a multiple of 128 bits (16 bytes). Key is the AES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. The lengths of Key and IVec must be 128 bits (16 bytes).

func.name: aes_cbc_128_decrypt(Key, IVec, Cipher) -> Text
func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to AES in Cipher Block Chaining mode

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to AES in Cipher Block Chaining mode (CBC). Key is the AES key, and IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector. Key and IVec must have the same values as those used when encrypting. Cipher must be a multiple of 128 bits (16 bytes). The lengths of Key and IVec must be 128 bits (16 bytes).

func.name: aes_cbc_ivec(Data) -> IVec
func.fsummary: Get IVec to be used in next iteration of aes_cbc_*_[ecrypt|decrypt]

desc.p: Returns the IVec to be used in a next iteration of aes_cbc_*_[encrypt|decrypt]. Data is the encrypted data from the previous iteration step.

func.name: aes_ctr_encrypt(Key, IVec, Text) -> Cipher
func.fsummary: Encrypt Textaccording to AES in Counter mode

desc.p: Encrypts Text according to AES in Counter mode (CTR). Text can be any number of bytes. Key is the AES key and must be either 128, 192 or 256 bits long. IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector of 128 bits (16 bytes).

func.name: aes_ctr_decrypt(Key, IVec, Cipher) -> Text
func.fsummary: Decrypt Cipheraccording to AES in Counter mode

desc.p: Decrypts Cipher according to AES in Counter mode (CTR). Cipher can be any number of bytes. Key is the AES key and must be either 128, 192 or 256 bits long. IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector of 128 bits (16 bytes).

Initializes the state for use in streaming AES encryption using Counter mode (CTR). Key is the AES key and must be either 128, 192, or 256 bts long. IVec is an arbitrary initializing vector of 128 bits (16 bytes). This state is for use with aes_ctr_stream_encrypt and aes_ctr_stream_decrypt.

Encrypts Text according to AES in Counter mode (CTR). This function can be used to encrypt a stream of text using a series of calls instead of requiring all text to be in memory. Text can be any number of bytes. State is initialized using aes_ctr_stream_init. NewState is the new streaming encryption state that must be passed to the next call to aes_ctr_stream_encrypt. Cipher is the encrypted cipher text.

Decrypts Cipher according to AES in Counter mode (CTR). This function can be used to decrypt a stream of ciphertext using a series of calls instead of requiring all ciphertext to be in memory. Cipher can be any number of bytes. State is initialized using aes_ctr_stream_init. NewState is the new streaming encryption state that must be passed to the next call to aes_ctr_stream_encrypt. Text is the decrypted data.

func.name: erlint(Mpint) -> N
mpint(N) -> Mpint
func.fsummary: Convert between binary multi-precision integer and erlang big integer

desc.p: Convert a binary multi-precision integer Mpint to and from an erlang big integer. A multi-precision integer is a binary with the following form: <<ByteLen:32/integer, Bytes:ByteLen/binary>> where both ByteLen and Bytes are big-endian. Mpints are used in some of the functions in crypto and are not translated in the API for performance reasons.

func.name: rand_bytes(N) -> binary()
func.fsummary: Generate a binary of random bytes

desc.p: Generates N bytes randomly uniform 0..255, and returns the result in a binary. Uses the crypto library pseudo-random number generator.

func.name: strong_rand_bytes(N) -> binary()
func.fsummary: Generate a binary of random bytes

desc.p: Generates N bytes randomly uniform 0..255, and returns the result in a binary. Uses a cryptographically secure prng seeded and periodically mixed with operating system provided entropy. By default this is the RAND_bytes method from OpenSSL.
May throw exception low_entropy in case the random generator failed due to lack of secure "randomness".

func.name: rand_uniform(Lo, Hi) -> N
func.fsummary: Generate a random number

desc.p: Generate a random number N, Lo =< N < Hi. Uses the crypto library pseudo-random number generator. The arguments (and result) can be either erlang integers or binary multi-precision integers. Hi must be larger than Lo.

func.name: strong_rand_mpint(N, Top, Bottom) -> Mpint
func.fsummary: Generate an N bit random number

desc.p: Generate an N bit random number using OpenSSL's cryptographically strong pseudo random number generator BN_rand.

The parameter Top places constraints on the most significant bits of the generated number. If Top is 1, then the two most significant bits will be set to 1, if Top is 0, the most significant bit will be 1, and if Top is -1 then no constraints are applied and thus the generated number may be less than N bits long.
If Bottom is 1, then the generated number is constrained to be odd.
May throw exception low_entropy in case the random generator failed due to lack of secure "randomness".

func.name: mod_exp(N, P, M) -> Result
func.fsummary: Perform N ^ P mod M

desc.p: This function performs the exponentiation N ^ P mod M, using the crypto library.

func.name: rsa_sign(DataOrDigest, Key) -> Signature
rsa_sign(DigestType, DataOrDigest, Key) -> Signature
func.fsummary: Sign the data using rsa with the given key.

type.v: Key = [E, N, D] | [E, N, D, P1, P2, E1, E2, C]
type.d: Where E is the public exponent, N is public modulus and D is the private exponent.
type.v: P1, P2, E1, E2, C = Mpint
type.d: The longer key format contains redundant information that will make the calculation faster. P1,P2 are first and second prime factors. E1,E2 are first and second exponents. C is the CRT coefficient. Terminology is taken from RFC 3447.
type.v: DigestType = md5 | sha | sha224 | sha256 | sha384 | sha512

desc.p: Creates a RSA signature with the private key Key of a digest. The digest is either calculated as a DigestType digest of Data or a precalculated binary Digest.

func.name: rsa_verify(DataOrDigest, Signature, Key) -> Verified
rsa_verify(DigestType, DataOrDigest, Signature, Key) -> Verified
func.fsummary: Verify the digest and signature using rsa with given public key.

type.d: Where E is the public exponent and N is public modulus.
type.v: DigestType = md5 | sha | sha224 | sha256 | sha384 | sha512

desc.p: Verifies that a digest matches the RSA signature using the signer's public key Key. The digest is either calculated as a DigestType digest of Data or a precalculated binary Digest.
May throw exception notsup in case the chosen DigestType is not supported by the underlying OpenSSL implementation.

func.name: rsa_public_encrypt(PlainText, PublicKey, Padding) -> ChipherText
func.fsummary: Encrypts Msg using the public Key.

type.d: Where E is the public exponent and N is public modulus.

desc.p: Encrypts the PlainText (usually a session key) using the PublicKey and returns the cipher. The Padding decides what padding mode is used, rsa_pkcs1_padding is PKCS #1 v1.5 currently the most used mode and rsa_pkcs1_oaep_padding is EME-OAEP as defined in PKCS #1 v2.0 with SHA-1, MGF1 and an empty encoding parameter. This mode is recommended for all new applications. The size of the Msg must be less than byte_size(N)-11 if rsa_pkcs1_padding is used, byte_size(N)-41 if rsa_pkcs1_oaep_padding is used and byte_size(N) if rsa_no_padding is used. Where byte_size(N) is the size part of an Mpint-1.

func.name: rsa_private_decrypt(ChipherText, PrivateKey, Padding) -> PlainText
func.fsummary: Decrypts ChipherText using the private Key.

type.v: PrivateKey = [E, N, D] | [E, N, D, P1, P2, E1, E2, C]
type.d: Where E is the public exponent, N is public modulus and D is the private exponent.
type.v: P1, P2, E1, E2, C = Mpint
type.d: The longer key format contains redundant information that will make the calculation faster. P1,P2 are first and second prime factors. E1,E2 are first and second exponents. C is the CRT coefficient. Terminology is taken from RFC 3447.

desc.p: Decrypts the ChipherText (usually a session key encrypted with rsa_public_encrypt/3) using the PrivateKey and returns the message. The Padding is the padding mode that was used to encrypt the data, see rsa_public_encrypt/3.

func.name: rsa_private_encrypt(PlainText, PrivateKey, Padding) -> ChipherText
func.fsummary: Encrypts Msg using the private Key.

type.v: PrivateKey = [E, N, D] | [E, N, D, P1, P2, E1, E2, C]
type.d: Where E is the public exponent, N is public modulus and D is the private exponent.
type.v: P1, P2, E1, E2, C = Mpint
type.d: The longer key format contains redundant information that will make the calculation faster. P1,P2 are first and second prime factors. E1,E2 are first and second exponents. C is the CRT coefficient. Terminology is taken from RFC 3447.

desc.p: Encrypts the PlainText using the PrivateKey and returns the cipher. The Padding decides what padding mode is used, rsa_pkcs1_padding is PKCS #1 v1.5 currently the most used mode. The size of the Msg must be less than byte_size(N)-11 if rsa_pkcs1_padding is used, and byte_size(N) if rsa_no_padding is used. Where byte_size(N) is the size part of an Mpint-1.

func.name: rsa_public_decrypt(ChipherText, PublicKey, Padding) -> PlainText
func.fsummary: Decrypts ChipherText using the public Key.

type.d: Where E is the public exponent and N is public modulus

desc.p: Decrypts the ChipherText (encrypted with rsa_private_encrypt/3) using the PrivateKey and returns the message. The Padding is the padding mode that was used to encrypt the data, see rsa_private_encrypt/3.

func.name: dss_sign(DataOrDigest, Key) -> Signature
dss_sign(DigestType, DataOrDigest, Key) -> Signature
func.fsummary: Sign the data using dsa with given private key.

type.d: Where P, Q and G are the dss parameters and X is the private key.

desc.p: Creates a DSS signature with the private key Key of a digest. The digest is either calculated as a SHA1 digest of Data or a precalculated binary Digest.
A deprecated feature is having DigestType = 'none' in which case DataOrDigest is a precalculated SHA1 digest.

func.name: dss_verify(DataOrDigest, Signature, Key) -> Verified
dss_verify(DigestType, DataOrDigest, Signature, Key) -> Verified
func.fsummary: Verify the data and signature using dsa with given public key.

type.d: Where P, Q and G are the dss parameters and Y is the public key.

desc.p: Verifies that a digest matches the DSS signature using the public key Key. The digest is either calculated as a SHA1 digest of Data or is a precalculated binary Digest.
A deprecated feature is having DigestType = 'none' in which case DataOrDigest is a precalculated SHA1 digest binary.

section.title: DES in CBC mode
section.p: The Data Encryption Standard (DES) defines an algorithm for encrypting and decrypting an 8 byte quantity using an 8 byte key (actually only 56 bits of the key is used).

When it comes to encrypting and decrypting blocks that are multiples of 8 bytes various modes are defined (NIST SP 800-38A). One of those modes is the Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode, where the encryption of an 8 byte segment depend not only of the contents of the segment itself, but also on the result of encrypting the previous segment: the encryption of the previous segment becomes the initializing vector of the encryption of the current segment.

Thus the encryption of every segment depends on the encryption key (which is secret) and the encryption of the previous segment, except the first segment which has to be provided with an initial initializing vector. That vector could be chosen at random, or be a counter of some kind. It does not have to be secret.

The following example is drawn from the old FIPS 81 standard (replaced by NIST SP 800-38A), where both the plain text and the resulting cipher text is settled. The following code fragment returns `true'.
section.pre:
Key = <<16#01,16#23,16#45,16#67,16#89,16#ab,16#cd,16#ef>>, IVec = <<16#12,16#34,16#56,16#78,16#90,16#ab,16#cd,16#ef>>, P = "Now is the time for all ", C = crypto:des_cbc_encrypt(Key, IVec, P), % Which is the same as P1 = "Now is t", P2 = "he time ", P3 = "for all ", C1 = crypto:des_cbc_encrypt(Key, IVec, P1), C2 = crypto:des_cbc_encrypt(Key, C1, P2), C3 = crypto:des_cbc_encrypt(Key, C2, P3),
C = <<C1/binary, C2/binary, C3/binary>>, C = <<16#e5,16#c7,16#cd,16#de,16#87,16#2b,16#f2,16#7c, 16#43,16#e9,16#34,16#00,16#8c,16#38,16#9c,16#0f, 16#68,16#37,16#88,16#49,16#9a,16#7c,16#05,16#f6>>, <<"Now is the time for all ">> == crypto:des_cbc_decrypt(Key, IVec, C).
section.p: The following is true for the DES CBC mode. For all decompositions P1 ++ P2 = P of a plain text message P (where the length of all quantities are multiples of 8 bytes), the encryption C of P is equal to C1 ++ C2, where C1 is obtained by encrypting P1 with Key and the initializing vector IVec, and where C2 is obtained by encrypting P2 with Key and the initializing vector last8(C1), where last(Binary) denotes the last 8 bytes of the binary Binary.

Similarly, for all decompositions C1 ++ C2 = C of a cipher text message C (where the length of all quantities are multiples of 8 bytes), the decryption P of C is equal to P1 ++ P2, where P1 is obtained by decrypting C1 with Key and the initializing vector IVec, and where P2 is obtained by decrypting C2 with Key and the initializing vector last8(C1), where last8(Binary) is as above.
For DES3 (which uses three 64 bit keys) the situation is the same.
